title: reporting file too big when updating nightly

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-nightly
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to nightly.

labels.name: T-release
labels.description: Relevant to the release subteam, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
today when I try to update my toolchain nightly, it failed in a 'File too big' error.
totally no idea how to fix it
```
C:\WINDOWS\system32>rustup toolchain update nightly
info: syncing channel updates for 'nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu'
603.2 KiB / 603.2 KiB (100 %) 461.8 KiB/s in  2s ETA:  0s
info: latest update on 2020-09-16, rust version 1.48.0-nightly (6af1bdda5 2020-09-15)
info: downloading component 'cargo'
info: downloading component 'clippy'
info: downloading component 'rust-docs'
info: downloading component 'rust-mingw'
info: downloading component 'rust-std'
info: downloading component 'rustc'
info: downloading component 'rustfmt'
info: installing component 'cargo'
info: installing component 'clippy'
info: installing component 'rust-docs'
 13.2 MiB /  13.2 MiB (100 %) 633.6 KiB/s in 52s ETA:  0s
  8 IO-ops /   8 IO-ops (100 %)   0 IOPS in  3s ETA:  0s
info: installing component 'rust-mingw'
  4.2 MiB /   4.2 MiB (100 %)   4.0 MiB/s in  2s ETA:  0s
info: installing component 'rust-std'

info: installing component 'rustc'

  4 IO-ops /   4 IO-ops (100 %)   0 IOPS in  5s ETA:  0s
info: rolling back changes
error: File too big rustc-nightly-x86_64-pc-windows-gnu/rustc/bin/rustc_driver-2019a84683ce56c0.dll 202647192
```
